name: Economic Affairs
description: The downturn of the German economy, following the plunge of the Berlin Stock Exchange, has affected many nations within Europe. Unfortunately, we have not been able to weather the storm and have been hit just as bad as many other nations. If we are to make a full recovery, we must take steps to strengthen our economy.

name: Retain Agrarianism
description: Rather than turning Bulgaria into an industrial nation, we must ensure that we remember our roots and retain our agrarian ideals. The people need to be taught better farming techniques, acquire new tools, and acquire more land in order to help kickstart the economy.

name: Increased Wheat Exports
description: Wheat, one of Bulgaria's most bountiful and vital crops, is important in these times of crisis. As there is a high demand for it, we must turn our gaze towards increasing our output of wheat so that we may export more and increase our profit.

name: Rural Education
description: We must bring education to the peasants within Bulgaria and help teach them new and more efficient farming techniques so as to increase both our agricultural output and help our farmers better compete against machines. That way, we can ensure that nearly every farmer will have a job.

name: Redistribute Land to the Peasants
description: While confiscating land is, by no means, a popular measure, we can make it popular by redistributing the confiscated land to the peasants, who will need the extra land in order to help increase agricultural output and enrich the nation.

name: Lower the Tax Burden on the Peasantry
description: By lowering taxes on the peasantry, we can encourage them to increase their output of agricultural goods, as they will be allowed to keep a greater margin of the profit, while also improving their living standards in general.

name: Develop the Countryside
description: While many of our cities, such as Sofia and Plovdiv, are well developed, the countryside and other rural areas are seldom paid attention to and, thus, ignored. We must begin investment into our rural regions in order to better link our nation.

name: Agricultural Subsidisation
description: In order to truly solidify the profitability of agriculture, we must take steps to fund it and provide farmers with money in order to incentivise them to continually produce more crops.

name: Increased Agricultural Output
description: We must continually advocate for continued agricultural production and increase our production of crops and find new and more efficient agricultural methods. It is key that we formalise the role of agriculture in the nation so that we may dig ourselves out of the current crisis.

name: Adopt Industrialisation
description: We must turn towards the industrialisation of Bulgaria during these chaotic times. While agrarianism is indeed a big part of our nation, the times are changing and nations around the world are becoming more reliant on factories rather than farms. While this may displease a large portion of our population, industrialisation is a necessary measure that must be undertaken.

name: Maintain Protectionism
description: It is important that we prioritise the needs of the Bulgarian people rather than allowing for the free flow of goods, which could see the outsourcing of jobs. We must turn our gaze towards Mitteleuropa, the biggest economic bloc in Europe, and enact tariffs against them in order to protect the rights of the Bulgarian worker.

name: University of Sofia
description: Founded on the 1st of October, 1888, the University of Sofia is Bulgaria's oldest higher education institution. By pouring government funds into the development and expansion of the services offered by the university, we can allow for the education of our citizenry.

name: Urban Development
description: While Bulgaria's urban areas are, by far, the most developed areas of the nation, it is also clear to many that the amount of development in those areas lags behind that of our European counterparts. We must invest more in our urban areas so as to spur resettlement there, thereby allowing for the creation of new jobs.

name: Darzhavna Aeroplanna Rabotilnitsa
description: We should not rely on foreign designers to supply our air force with the aircraft it needs. We will carry out a large expansion and modernization of the facilities of our State Aircraft Workshop in Bozhurishte.

name: Economic Growth in City Centres
description: In order to further stimulate economic activity and ensure further development in urban areas, we must begin the massive undertaking of public works projects and infrastructural development programmes.

name: Work with Arsenal AD
description: Bulgaria's oldest arms supplier, Arsenal AD, which is headquartered in Kazanlak, specialises primarily in the creation of military equipment and affiliated firearms. By working together with them, and providing government subsidies, we can boost our domestic arms industry and better supply our military.

name: Empower the Bulgarian National Bank
description: It is of the utmost importance that we work on revaluing our currency, the Bulgarian lev, by working in lockstep with the Bulgarian National Bank. Through promoting the stability of our currency and imposing proper regulations on the bank, we can better control the resilience of the lev.

name: Examining the Budget
description: The collapse of the Berlin Stock Exchange has brought about a period of economic uncertainty within Bulgaria. This, of course, has negatively impacted the budget and, by extension, government spending. If we are to pull ourselves out of this financial rut, we must take a close look at the status of the budget and rebalancing it.

name: Slash Military Pensions
description: It is clear that we can no longer hope to maintain the extensive military pensions granted to veterans following the end of the Weltkrieg, which has strained our finances even prior to Black Monday. While it will be an extremely unpopular and controversial decision, we must cut spending on pensions.

name: Maintain Military Pensions
description: While it is true that the maintenance of military pensions has been straining our already stretched finances, we cannot simply slash pensions and leave our heroes to suffer. No, we must bear this burden, for it is our obligation to the veterans, who had helped to bring about the golden age, to do so.

name: The End of Black Monday
description: Thankfully, we have finally managed to end the economic plague known as Black Monday and have dug ourselves out of this rut. In addition we have also managed to strengthen our economy, solidify the stability of our currency, and gain the trust of the people by bringing about an economic recovery.

name: The Bulgarian Land Forces
description: Known as the 'Prussia of the Balkans' the Bulgarian Land Forces have been the pride and backbone of the Bulgarian nation. We must ensure that they remain strong and continually bolster them so as to maintain our hegemony in the Balkans.

name: Maintaining the Hegemony
description: We cannot show or even allow our enemies to perceive any sort of weakness. We must assert our power in the Balkans and remind the surrounding nations of the Bulgarian hegemony and the superiority of the Bulgarian Land Forces, lest we lose the territorial gains made following the Weltkrieg.

name: Defending our Land
description: It is crucial that we invigorate the soldiers and officers within the armed forces and convince them to defend our rightful lands at all costs. If our enemies gain any sort of advantage over us, it will not matter for the Bulgarian Land Forces will fight on, unending in their battle to save and preserve Bulgaria.

name: Increase Infantry Equipment Production
description: A key component of maintaining the size of the Bulgarian Land Forces is the continual production of equipment. By upping the production of infantry equipment, we can ensure that every soldier will have a firearm.

name: Further Tank Research
description: Invented by the British in 1916 during the Weltkrieg, tanks are able to breakthrough enemy lines and possess firepower never before seen. Researching armour will be crucial to the Bulgarian war effort.

name: Mountain Infantry
description: Making an effort to develop and refine our mountain fighting techniques will be crucial to warfare in the Balkans; especially taking into account how mountainous Macedonia and southern Bulgaria are.

name: Draw Up Battle Plans
description: In order to maintain a certain readiness, we must draft up contingency plans in the case that our enemies, who have encircled us like vultures they are, decide to go on the offensive.

name: Advancements in Artillery
description: Artillery has been a key component of war ever since the Napoleonic Wars and had played a crucial role during the Weltkrieg. Investing in this technology would be extremely helpful as artillery is able to be fired towards distances that infantry cannot reach.

name: Developments in Motorised Infantry
description: Motorised infantry is crucial in that it provides protection from enemy fire and can help transfer our troops from one place to another at swift speeds.

name: Investing in Support Elements
description: Logistics, field hospitals, and engineers are all crucial support elements to any division. If we are to fight smarter, and allow for the preservation of our men and emerge victorious, we must make strides in the field of support equipment.

name: Georgi Rakovski Military Academy
description: Based in Sofia, the Georgi Rakovski Military Academy is Bulgaria's oldest military institution of higher education. By pouring funds into the academy, we can ensure the quality of our officers are better than ever.

name: Expand the Reserves
description: The Bulgarian Land Forces has always been known for its vast reserves of manpower. With the potentially impending tide of Greek, Romanian, Serbian, and Turk soldiers, it is clear that we must expand our manpower reserves so that every able-bodied Bulgarian will be ready to defend his country.

name: Well Trained Officers
description: We cannot allow the quality of our officers to falter or decrease in the slightest. The armed forces are the pride of our nation, and our officers must be of a certain quality if we are to maintain military supremacy in the Balkans.

name: State Armaments Manufacturers
description: Pouring government funds into the subsidisation of key armaments manufacturers, and even going as far as to create state-owned factories, is crucial to the Bulgarian war effort. After all, more factories means greater production of weapons.

name: Increased Weapons Production Capability
description: While the production of infantry equipment is crucial, it is also important that we turn our gaze towards focusing on the production of other key weapons. We must ensure that every division receives the supplies that it deems necessary.

name: Doctrinal Re-evaluation
description: The Weltkrieg saw the use and emergence of new doctrines, many of them proving their effectiveness in one way or another. As warfare continues to evolve to this day, it is clear that we must take a good, hard look at the doctrine used by our armed forces and go from there to find the most appropriate doctrine for our troops.

name: Border Fortification
description: While invigorating our soldiers is certainly helpful, it is also vital that we begin to place fortifications on our borders so as to ensure that key areas will be nigh impossible to take. And even if the enemy does manage to take fortified areas, it will cost them dearly in terms of both equipment and manpower.

name: Honouring our Heroes
description: We must remember the sacrifices made by those during the Weltkrieg. Those veterans who had fought, some now crippled–others dead, and brought about the Bulgarian golden age must be properly honoured and mourned. We shall not, must not, forget our soldiers.

name: Rouse the Masses
description: We must take to rallying the spirit of the Bulgarian people and bringing up their morale so as to incentivise them to fight for the defence and preservation of the Bulgarian state. Long live Bulgaria!

name: Reorganisation of the Pension System
description: As seen with the massive debts incurred following our payment of the veterans' pensions, it is clear that we must reorganise our pension system and work towards better and more efficiently apportioning pensions to our soldiers.

name: A Military with A State
description: We have done all that we can–improved the quality of our officers, invested in new types of equipment, expanded the manpower reserves, and spent our efforts on military research–in order to ensure that the supremacy of the Bulgarian Land Forces remains everlasting. Long live the military!

name: The Liberals Remain in Power
description: The Liberal Party, largely seen as the party of the status-quo by those further to the left of the political spectrum, has been in power for a long time. Currently, the platform supported by Liberals is one of increased representation for the people, through the National Assembly, and progressive reforms.

name: Assert the Power of the Tsar
description: It is important that the power of the Tsar is stressed and his authority not undermined for he acts as the unifier for the Bulgarian nation and the Bulgarian people.

name: Empowering the National Assembly
description: A key tenet of the Liberal Party is empowering the parliament, known as the National Assembly, so as to better represent the views of the Bulgarian people and ensure that democracy within Bulgaria is not compromised.

name: Keeping Radicalism at Bay
description: While it is important that we ensure that the views of the Bulgarian people are properly represented, it is also important to keep in mind that tough times call for tough measures. We must take action to combat the various parties which would seek to destabilise Bulgaria or espouse ideas that could potentially threaten the royal family.

name: Ensuring Political Stability
description: It is of the utmost importance that we do not allow radicals and/or troublemakers from both within and without to cause trouble for Bulgaria. We cannot, and must not, allow the state to become destabilised, lest our enemies take advantage of us during our darkest hour.

name: Institution of Progressive Reforms
description: We must take to supporting the downtrodden and disenfranchised, granting them equal freedoms as their fellow citizens. In addition, we must take to protecting liberty and democracy within Bulgaria, which will allow for a thriving social atmosphere.

name: Full Abolition of Press Censorship
description: While Malinov and the Liberals had partially abolished press censorship prior to the Weltkrieg, many of the restrictions placed upon the press continued to remain. It is time we allow for the press to properly thrive within Bulgaria; we cannot continue to restrict them forever. The people have the right to receive unadulterated news.

name: Proportional Representation
description: By instituting a proportional voting system, we can ensure that elections are fairer and that candidates and parties receive the proper amount of votes. We cannot allow the views of the Bulgarian people to go unnoticed.

name: Political Meritocracy
description: We must base our political system not off of personal motivations or nepotism, but off of meritocratic ideals. Every party, that is deemed fit, of course, shall be given equal opportunity in order to gain popularity within parliament and better represent its supporters. Democracy must be allowed to thrive within Bulgaria.

name: Support the Bulgarian Women's Union
description: Julia Malinova, Malinov's wife, is one of the leaders of the Bulgarian Women's Union and a big proponent of empowering women within Bulgaria. Malinov, and the Liberal Party itself, is very much in favour of improving the status of women within the nation. Thus, it is important that we take steps to support the organisation.

name: Enact Universal Suffrage
description: The disenfranchised within Bulgaria must be given the right to vote. It is wrong of us to champion ourselves a progressive party if we do not grant each and every citizen equal rights. Women, just like men, should be allowed to vote for the party of their choosing and have their views represented.

name: Increased Ties with Russia
description: Malinov and the Liberals are known for their admiration of the Russian Republic, placing trust in them rather than in the Germans. If Bulgaria is to find a nation to protect its sovereignty, especially during these turbulent times, it is clear that Russia is the best nation to forge ties with.

name: Bulgarian-Russian Trade Deal
description: In order to gain access to preferred trade, and possess a trade partner in times of need, it is crucial that we turn to the Russians, our closest allies, and work towards enacting a trade deal with them.

name: Institute a Free Trade Policy
description: A free trade policy will allow us to better direct the flow and movement of goods, which will thereby help increase our exports and, in addition, foster economic ties with new nations.

name: Privatisation
description: By empowering the private sector, we can take the burden of payment off of the government, which will allow for an expanded budget, and increase efficiency within various economic institutions.

name: A Stable and United Bulgaria
description: Thankfully, it seems as though most, if not all, of our reforms were met with great success and backing of the Bulgarian people. We can rest easy knowing that we have done our job properly, for the Bulgarian state is stable, its people unified, and, throughout it all, we have managed to preserve liberty and democracy within our great nation. Long live Bulgaria!

name: The Absolutists have Taken Power
description: When the dust had settled, the Absolutist faction had emerged as the victorious party and is now in charge of Bulgaria. Comprised of hard-line military officers, and lead by Ferdinand's son, Boris, the Absolutists wish to bring power to where they feel it belongs: in the hands of the military and Tsar.

name: Empower the Bulgarian Land Forces
description: As stated earlier, it is of the utmost importance that the Bulgarian Land Forces be empowered for they are the reason that Bulgaria has managed to enjoy its dominance in the Balkans. In addition, however, it is crucial that we give the military leeway to do as it sees fit, so as to allow for a, hopefully, more powerful armed forces.

name: Loyal Officers in High Command
description: We cannot allow those who oppose our platform to remain in the upper echelons of the military. Steps must be taken in order to replace officers in high command unwilling to aid or opposed to our cause. The military must be lead by men who possess nerves of steel, are loyal to the Tsar, and are ready to do whatever it takes to defend Bulgaria.

name: Bolster the National Guards Unit
description: Founded in 1879, the National Guards Unit is a successor to Prince Alexander I's Personal Cavalry Convoy. By properly equipping them and ensuring that their arms and tactics are both up to date, we can ensure better protection for the Tsar.

name: Idealised Sovereign
description: It is crucial that we take steps to convince the people that the Tsar is the one, and true, unifier for the Bulgarian nation. We must go that extra length and ensure that the Tsar is idealised by his subjects.

name: Expand the Tsar's Powers
description: The Tsar must be given the right to do as he sees fit, when he sees fit. It is crucial that the Tsar be empowered and be allowed to take direct action in order for the safety of the Bulgarian nation and its people.

name: Suppress the Agrarians
description: The Bulgarian Agrarian National Union has been a thorn in our side for far too long. They have already hurt Bulgaria much by espousing the ideals of pan-Slavism and greater co-operation with our enemy, Serbia. We cannot allow such an organisation to remain unchecked, lest the Agrarians bring about anarchy within Bulgaria.

name: Ban Political Parties
description: We do not need political parties within Bulgaria. They only seek to further divide the people for their own petty agendas and do what they deem is best for themselves. What we truly need is a society with no political parties, in which the Tsar and the military will safeguard and represent the views Bulgarian people.

name: Tighten Electoral Laws
description: As it stands, too many radical political parties are allowed to flourish in the National Assembly. We must put an end to that and tighten electoral laws. That way, we can combat both the radicals within our government and, subsequently, destroy radicalism within Bulgaria.

name: Empower the Council of Ministers
description: We must begin to shift the balance of power in favour of the Council of Ministers, the executive branch, so that the Tsar may empower those directly around him. This way, we can ensure that loyal advisers and supporters are at the helm, rather than a disloyal parliament.

name: Protect the Bulgarian People
description: We must be vigilant and protect the Bulgarian people from forces, both internal and external, which seek to harm them. It is of the utmost importance that we protect our citizens, for without them there is no Bulgarian state.

name: Looking Outward
description: We must begin to broaden our horizons and branch out in terms of international relations. Only once we have obtained allies can we begin to properly assert ourselves on the world stage and integrate ourselves into the international community.

name: Reconciliation with Germany
description: The Liberals and Malinov had very much soured Bulgarian and German relations due to their rampant Germanophobia. We must send a delegation to the German Empire in an attempt to reverse these diplomatic blunders. It will not be easy, however.

name: Bulgarian-German Economic Ties
description: To our great relief, it seems as though the German Empire has taken kindly to our reconciliation efforts and is willing to rekindle the flames of comradery once more. In order to further deepen our ties, we must look towards the institution of a trade policy within our nations. This will also help us gain preferred access to German trade.

name: German Military Mission
description: In order to strengthen our already strong army, it would be wise to turn to the Germans, yet again, and ask them to send a military mission. This way, we can better learn tactics that had developed following the Weltkrieg and continue the continual modernisation of our armed forces.

name: A Stronger and Loyal Bulgaria
description: We have finally managed to consolidate power under the Tsar. His rule, alongside the military's, is absolute. The Bulgarian people do not question the new political realities and are willing to live under our regime. Long live the Tsar!

name: The Rule of the Syndicalists
description: In the midst of the chaos, the Narrow Socialists have managed to take power in Bulgaria. While not as popular as the Anarchist Federation, the syndicalists have managed to effectively consolidate their power... for now. The question remains, however: can the state be effectively restructured in order to support this new system?

name: Restructuring the State
description: Measures must be taken in order to restructure the very core of the state and the minds of the people to accept and conform to syndicalism. We can no longer allow reactionary ideals to thrive within Bulgaria and consume our way of life.

name: Empower the Free Trade Unions
description: A key tenet of syndicalism is union control over the state. By empowering the Free Trade Unions, one of the biggest and oldest unions in Bulgaria, we can begin the gradual transition to union control over the state.

name: International Alliances
description: It is important that we broaden our horizons with regards to seeking new alliances. As it stands, we are fairly isolated and surrounded on all sides by reactionaries. By finding ourselves an ally to aid us in our time of need, we can ensure the survival of both the Bulgarian state and the revolution.

name: Consolidating our Power
description: The only way that we can fully ensure that Bulgaria will remain a syndicalist nation for the years to come is to swiftly, yet effectively, consolidate our power and oust any reactionaries who would seek to destabilise the current regime.

name: Industrialisation Programmes
description: For far too long Bulgaria has remained an agrarian nation, stagnating in terms of economic affairs when compared to other nations. We must begin to undertake industrialisation programmes so as to turn our economy into a more industrial one.

name: Communal Farming
description: Allowing the state to own farms and farmers to collectively run farms is the key to achieving an efficient agricultural output. The peasants and small farmers must be empowered rather than the capitalist agribusinessmen.

name: Removing Vestiges of Monarchism
description: One of the most important societal shifts that we must begin to foster is the removal of all monarchism or any monarchist tendencies within Bulgaria. No kings or royal families shall be allowed to oppress the people any longer!

name: Weaken the Military
description: As it stands, the military is one of the most outspoken opponents of the new regime. We must take to reorganising the structure of the military and replacing reactionary officers with ones that will be loyal to our cause. This will not be without consequence, however.

name: Fight the Reactionaries
description: Remaining vigilant and fighting any reactionaries is something that must be done in order to secure our status as a syndicalist state and protect the people themselves. We cannot allow for enemies of the state to corrupt the people by preaching destructive and violent ideals.

name: Raise Living Standards
description: While industrialising the nation is all fair and good, we should also consider raising living standards for the people of Bulgaria. The development of an educated middle class is important in order to ensure that we have a flourishing populace that can help advance the state.

name: A Fairer Electoral System
description: While the Liberal Party had claimed to be in favour of representing the views of all Bulgarians, the policies enacted under their rule did not reflect such claims. Parties which had leaned left were oftentimes targeted by the government and hurt as a result of the Liberal policies. We must take to reversing that and allowing for the representation of the views of the Bulgarian people.

name: Representation of the Peasantry
description: The peasantry are the ones who do the true work in Bulgaria; they are the ones who make our state what it truly is. We must ensure that they have a voice that is equal to that of every other citizen.

name: Bulgaria Under Syndicalism
description: Thankfully, it seems as though we have managed to consolidate power effectively and have instituted all of the policies we had sought to. We can safely say that Bulgaria is a syndicalist state, and can turn our gaze towards planning for a brighter, more optimistic future. Long live Bulgaria!

name: The Broad Socialists
description: Following the chaos which had engulfed Bulgaria, the Broad Socialists have managed to arise from the ashes as the new leaders of the Bulgarian state. Composed of bourgeoise-friendly socialists and constitutional monarchists, the Broad Socialists wish to see drastic change within Bulgaria.

name: Co-operate with the Bourgeoise
description: Unlike the Narrow Socialists, we are not against the idea of working with the bourgeoise in order to help further the position of the state and the people. Despite many on the left decrying this as a betrayal to socialist ideals, working with the bourgeoise is in fact a necessary measure.

name: Advance Political Democracy
description: Every part of the Bulgarian state must accept democratic ideals in order to ensure greater representation of the views of the people. This acceptance, however, must begin in the political sphere. We must advance political democracy.

name: Empower the Common Worker
description: We cannot allow the position of the common worker to be weakened or even compromised in the slightest. For they are the backbone behind the greatness that is Bulgaria.

name: Equal Opportunity
description: We must ensure that every party and every Bulgarian citizen be given the right to representation and state their viewpoint. After all, without such freedoms in place, we cannot truly call ourselves a democratic state.

name: Bolster the Free Trade Unions
description: In order to ensure that the workers have a platform to organise and protect their rights and freedom, we must work towards bolstering the Free Trade Unions, one of Bulgaria's oldest and biggest trade unions.

name: The Radical Democrats
description: Following the chaos which had engulfed Bulgaria, the Radical Democrats have managed to arise from the ashes as the new leaders of the Bulgarian state. Composed of democrats and constitutional monarchists, the Radical Democrats wish to see drastic change within Bulgaria.

name: Ensure Judicial Independence
description: A true democratic society requires a proper justice system. In order to achieve a proper justice system, we must ensure that the judiciary is independent and its judges incorrupt. The law must be obeyed.

name: Sovereignty of the People
description: The power of the state should be vested in the hands of the people though elected officials. We cannot allow autocrats and dictators to dismantle the state and consolidate power under their rule. The views of the people must be properly represented.

name: Political Decentralisation
description: It is key that we begin the decentralisation of the institutions of the state. As it stands, we gain nothing by centralising power in Sofia. We must take to empowering all of our citizens from every corner of Bulgaria.

name: Progressive Income Tax
description: The institution of a progressive income tax is paramount to our efforts in terms of attaining greater revenue from our citizens and also ensuring that every citizen pays their fair share.

name: Educational Development
description: Educating the Bulgarian youth is important if we are to develop a solid foundation for our citizens and contribute to and ensure the advancement and educational development of our state.

name: A Constitutional Monarchy
description: The powers of the Tsar and the wider royal family must be curbed in order to bring about a constitutional monarchy. The Tsar shall no longer possess sweeping powers and intervene within political matters, but shall instead be a symbol of unity for the Bulgarian people.

name: Rebuilding the Nation
description: Our nation has sustained great losses both in terms of infrastructural damages and lives lost. We must take to repairing our various institutions and healing the nation.

name: Repairing the Peoples' Pride
description: Following the loss of many of our territories and the failure of Stamboliyski's government, the psyche of the Bulgarian people has been thoroughly ruined. We must take to reminding the Bulgarian people why they, and our nation, is so great. We must restore the confidence of the people, lest we fall even further.

name: Seek New Alliances
description: In the spirit of reconciliation and rebuilding, it is time for our country to look outward for new alliances that can take us into the future.

name: A Liberal Bulgaria
description: We have managed to bring about all of the reforms that we had sought out to push through. Bulgaria is now a more liberal and fairer nation, with the Tsar serving as the unifier for the Bulgarian people. The future seems optimistic. Long live the Bulgarian people!

name: The Agrarian National Union
description: Rising from the chaos that engulfed the nation, the Agrarians have taken control of the country. Their anti-imperialist vision would see Bulgaria freed from militaristic expansion, and intend to pursue peace and greater union with their Balkan neighbours.

name: A Bulgarian Republic
description: The Agrarians have no qualms about tossing out the monarchy, despite any resistance that entails. The government, they say, needs to be restructured as a republic and exist to serve the common people first and foremost.

name: De-Militarization
description: Bulgaria has built up a broad military tradition, one that costs the nation greatly. De-militarizing will allow those resources to instead be channeled into the country's development.

name: The Land Reform Acts
description: Land redistribution and reform is one of the Agrarian's top priorities. Mechanization is not the answer, but that does not mean that agriculture cannot be improved and expanded, and land usage better managed.

name: Organize the Peasants
description: Bulgaria's true strength comes from its common folk. The peasants need to be organized across the country's vast rural regions, both for the maintenance of order as well as a first line of defense should the unthinkable happen.

name: A Path to Peace
description: Bulgaria has earned only hatred in its pursuit of an imperialistic dream. The time has come to repair relations with its neighbours, and promise to live it peace as a member of the Greater Balkans.

name: Stamboliyski's Dream
description: One of Aleksandar Stamboliyski's biggest dreams has always been the creation of a pan-Slavic state, in which the south Slavs of Europe would unite together and form one nation. Perhaps we could petition the Serbs to ask for our acceptance into their union? That being said, this is an unpopular idea amongst many powerful Bulgarians and we should tread carefully, lest chaos engulf the nation once again.

name: Swords into Plowshares
description: With the mighty Bulgarian military tamed, resources may now be devoted towards increasing construction and prosperity across the nation!

name: Social Welfare
description: A program of proper social welfare is one of the Agrarian's greatest aims, and with it the Bulgarian peasant class as a whole may be elevated.

name: Sovereign and Whole
description: Unlike what many would assume, a lack of focus on the military does not mean a lack of worry about defense. Bulgaria must be secure if it is to be prosperous.

name: Peace and Order
description: Great efforts must be undertaken to sell the Agrarian dream to the people, to ensure stability and co-operation among its disparate political groups.

name: A New Agrarian Alliance
description: The great undertaking is near completion! Bulgarian's Agrarians have rebuilt the nation from the literal ground up, and the mighty republic can now enjoy the fruits of its peace and harmony.

name: The Bulgarian Navy
description: It is paramount that we turn our gaze towards the expansion and maintenance of our navy, especially considering the rapid changes being made to naval warfare and the great importance being placed on the possesses ion of a proper navy.

name: U-Boat Operations
description: In order to ensure that we can effectively destroy enemy shipping routes and strike at unprepared enemy ships, we must begin the construction of u-boats.

name: Build Light Cruisers
description: Equipped with protective armour, light cruisers allow for the protection of our convoys and serve as destroyer command ships. We must look to invest more in these ships.

name: Focus on Destroyer Construction
description: Destroyers are both durable and manoeuvrable ships that are used to defend the main vessels, convoys, and battle groups. We should look into creating more of them.

name: Develop the Varna Naval Base
description: It is paramount that we place an emphasis on naval warfare and develop the Varna naval base. That way, we can ensure that our nation is better prepared in the face of potential naval warfare while also having the ability to house more ships.

name: Further Naval Aircraft Research
description: By having the navy and the air force co-operate, we can ensure aerial superiority no matter where we are. We shall rule the land and the seas!

name: The Bulgarian Air Force
description: It is paramount that we turn our gaze towards the expansion and maintenance of our air force, especially considering the rapid changes being made to aerial warfare and the great importance being placed on the possession of a proper air force.

name: Destroy Enemy Supply Lines
description: Bomber planes are crucial to the war effort in that they allow for the destruction of enemy supply lines effectively, yet from a remote area meaning that, at the end of the day, we will cause more damage while losing fewer lives.

name: Close Air Support
description: The protection of our men from all angles, especially the sky, is paramount to the war effort. We must begin to research close air support technology.

name: Invest in Fighters
description: In order to ensure aerial superiority and the destruction of enemy planes, we must begin to invest in fighter planes.

name: Spread our Resources
description: Rather than concentrating our efforts solely on building new airbases or naval bases, we must focus our attention on building up our naval and aerial institutions.

name: Build New Airbases
description: It is paramount that we place an emphasis on aerial warfare and build new airbases. That way, we can ensure that our nation is better connected while also having the ability to house more planes.

name: Naval Doctrines
description: Allowing our admirals to co-ordinate and map our the route our navy will take alongside training our naval officers to adapt to these new techniques will be crucial in modernising and strengthening our navy.

name: Aerial Doctrines
description: We should teach our pilots new methods on how to fly planes. That way, we can outsmart the enemy and greatly increase our understanding of aerial warfare.

name: Bulgarisation
description: The recent protests regarding the status of Muslim minorities within our country have shown us that we must embark on the road of fully integrating them into the Bulgarian state as true Bulgarians.

name: Close Sharia Family Courts
description: Sharia courts, most often used in Bulgaria by the Pomaks and Turks as a way to settle inter-family disputes, have long been a blemish upon our great nation and its Orthodox people. If we are to remove all traces of the Ottoman Turks from our land, we must begin by shutting down these institutions and have the users abide by Bulgarian civil law.

name: Bulgarian Language Exams
description: Even the most ignorant of people can understand that it is calamitous when your own subjects are unable to even speak the official language of your nation. That is why we must have the Muslim minorities within our nations administer their affairs in Bulgarian and subject the Islamic officials to Bulgarian language exams.

name: Forcibly Integrate the Pomaks
description: The Pomaks are, for all intents and purposes, Bulgarians who had been Islamicised by the Ottomans during their conquest of the Balkans. This is why we must take great care to introduce them to the habits and mindsets of our Christian population so that they may be coerced into accepting their Bulgarian national identity.

name: Ban Turkish Political Parties
description: For far too long have Turkish societies and political parties been a great thorn in the side of Bulgaria. We must no longer allow them to operate for we have been rather lenient towards them. If we are to better integrate the Turks, then we cannot have them advocating for minority rights.

name: Colonise Muslim Regions
description: If we are to pacify Muslim majority regions, it is only understandable that we incentivise our Christian population to move to those areas and teach the Turks and Pomaks what it means to be a Bulgarian and Bulgarian values.

name: Administer Minority Affairs in Turkish
description: The recent protests regarding the status of Muslim minorities within our country have shown us that we must embark on the road of providing only the Turkish Muslims with autonomy, while integrating the rest.

name: Grant Muslim Autonomy
description: The recent protests regarding the status of Muslim minorities within our country have shown us that we must embark on the road of granting all Muslims within Bulgarian borders autonomy.

name: Elected Muftis
description: Allowing the Muslim community to elect their own muftis is important if we are to truly give them proper autonomy.

name: The Schooling Issue
description: Clarifying the stance of the Bulgarian government on the issue of schooling for Muslim communities is important if we are to ever bridge the gap between our native populace and the Muslim peoples that reside within Bulgaria.

name: Promote Friendship Societies
description: So as to better relations between us and the already existing substantial Muslim minority within Bulgaria, it is important that we focus on the promotion of friendship societies.

name: Funding of Mosques
description: Due to recent Muslim unrest, it is important that we clarify our position on the funding of mosques. We could either continue our present course and fund mosques through the treasury, or we could force wealthy Muslims to use their own funds for the maintenance of mosques without the need for much state oversight of individual mosques.

name: State Funding
description: We have decided to continue the policy of funding mosques via the use of the state treasury, much to the displeasure of a portion of our Christian citizenry.

name: Private Funding
description: We have decided to end the policy of funding mosques via the use of the state treasury and thus place the burden on wealthy Muslims, much to the displeasure of a portion of our Muslim citizenry.

name: Extend the Use of Sharia
description: Providing more autonomy to our Muslim population via extending the use of Sharia is important if we are to keep them satisfied.
